pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi moduleÔÉÅ

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.ewt2d_Voronoi_Filterbank(sizeImg, vorocells, tau, extH, extW)[source]ÔÉÅ

Builds the filter bank based on the detected Voronoi cells.

Parameters:

  • sizeImg (tuple) ‚Äì Size of the image (height, width).

  • vorocells (list of ndarray) ‚Äì List of Voronoi cell masks (binary arrays).

  • tau (float) ‚Äì Transition width.

  • extH (bool or int) ‚Äì 1 (or True) if there is vertical extension, 0 otherwise.

  • extW (bool or int) ‚Äì 1 (or True) if there is horizontal extension, 0 otherwise.

Returns:

  • mfb (list of ndarray) ‚Äì List of filters (same size as sizeImg).

  • Author (Jerome Gilles)

  • Institution (San Diego State University)

  • Version (1.0 (07/16/2025))

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.ewt2d_Voronoi_LP_function(x, tau)[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the Littlewood-Paley value based on the provided distance.

Parameters:

  • x (float) ‚Äì Distance from the edge.

  • tau (float) ‚Äì Transition width.

Returns:

  • y (float) ‚Äì Value of the filter.

  • Author (Jerome Gilles)

  • Institution (San Diego State University)

  • Version (1.0 (07/16/2025))

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.ewt2d_Voronoi_Partition(centroids, sizeImg)[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the Voronoi partition corresponding to the provided centroids. The cells are properly assigned in order to guarantee a symmetric partition.

Parameters:

  • centroids (ndarray) ‚Äì Array of shape (n_centroids, 2) containing the coordinates of each centroid.

  • sizeImg (tuple) ‚Äì Size of the image (height, width).

Returns:

  • labelImage (ndarray) ‚Äì Image containing the Voronoi partition tagged from 1 to the number of cells.

  • voronoi_cells (list of ndarray) ‚Äì List of binary images containing the mask of each Voronoi cell.

  • Author (Jerome Gilles)

  • Institution (San Diego State University)

  • Version (1.0 (07/15/2025))

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.ewt2d_merge_symmetric(vor_cells, centers)[source]ÔÉÅ

Merge symmetric Voronoi cells based on their centers. :param vor_cells: List of Voronoi cell masks (binary arrays). :type vor_cells: list of ndarray :param centers: Array of shape (n_centers, 2) containing the coordinates of each center. :type centers: ndarray

Returns:

symvorcells ‚Äì List of merged Voronoi cell masks.

Return type:

list of ndarray

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.ewt2d_voronoi(f, params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute the 2D EWT based on a Voronoi partitioning of the Fourier domain.

Parameters:

  • f (2D ndarray) ‚Äì Input image.

  • params (dict) ‚Äì Transform parameters.

Returns:

  • ewtc (list of 2D ndarray) ‚Äì Collection of outputs of each EW filter.

  • mfb (list of 2D ndarray) ‚Äì The built filter bank.

  • maxima (ndarray) ‚Äì Coordinates of each meaningful detected maxima.

  • vorpartition (2D ndarray) ‚Äì Detected Voronoi partition.

  • plane (ndarray) ‚Äì Scale-space domain.

Notes

If params[‚Äúlog‚Äù] is set to True, then the detection is performed on the logarithm of the spectrum of f. params[‚ÄútypeDetect‚Äù] must be set to the wanted classification

method. The available options are: - ‚Äúotsu‚Äù : uses Otsu‚Äôs technique - ‚Äúhalfnormal‚Äù : uses a half-normal law to model the problem - ‚Äúempiricallaw‚Äù : uses the data itself to build a model of the problem - ‚Äúkmeans‚Äù : uses kmeans to classify

params[‚Äút‚Äù]: is the initial scale for the Gaussian kernel (0.8 is a good default value). params[‚Äúkn‚Äù]: is the kernel size for the Gaussian kernel (6 is a good default value). params[‚Äúniter‚Äù]: is the number of iterations through the scales (4 is a good default value). params[‚Äúedge‚Äù]: is the size (in pixels) of the strip to ignore at the edge of the image (0 is no strip). params[‚ÄúincludeCenter‚Äù]: if 1, the center of the image is included in the scale space maxima (0 is not included). params[‚Äútau‚Äù]: is the half width of the transition area for the Voronoi partition (0.1 is a good default value). params[‚Äúcomplex‚Äù]: if 1, the Voronoi partition is complex, otherwise it is real (0 is real).

Though usually not providing better results, this function allows regularization of the spectrum of f using the selected method set in params[‚Äúreg‚Äù]. The available methods are: - ‚Äúnone‚Äù : does nothing, returns f - ‚Äúgaussian‚Äù : convolve f with a Gaussian of length and standard

deviation given by params[‚Äúlengthfilter‚Äù] and params[‚Äúsigmafilter‚Äù], respectively

  • ‚Äúaverage‚Äù: convolve f with a constant filter of length given

    by params[‚Äúlengthfilter‚Äù]

Author: Jerome Gilles Institution: San Diego State University Version: 1.0 (07/21/2025)

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.iewt2d_voronoi(ewtc, mfb)[source]ÔÉÅ

Performs the inverse Empirical Voronoi Wavelet Transform, returning a reconstruction of the image.

Parameters:

  • ewtc (list of 2D ndarray) ‚Äì Empirical wavelet coefficients.

  • mfb (list of 2D ndarray) ‚Äì Corresponding empirical wavelet filters.

Returns:

  • rec (2D ndarray) ‚Äì Reconstructed image.

  • Author (Jerome Gilles)

  • Institution (San Diego State University)

  • Version (1.0 (07/16/2025))

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.plot_voronoi_filterbank(mfb)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot 2D empirical Voronoi filters

Parameters:ÔÉÅ

  • mfb: list

    list containing each Voronoi filter

Author: Jerome Gilles Institution: San Diego State University Version: 1.0 (07/16/2025)

pyewt.ewt2dvoronoi.show_ewt2d_voronoi_boundaries(f, vor, color=None, logspec=0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plots the edges of the Voronoi partition onto the magnitude of the Fourier spectrum of the input image.

Parameters:

  • f ‚Äì ndarray Input image.

  • vor ‚Äì ndarray Voronoi partition image (same size as f).

  • color ‚Äì list or tuple RGB color for the partition edges, values in [0,1]. Default is red.

  • logspec ‚Äì int If 1, plot the logarithm of the spectrum. Default is 0.

Author: Jerome Gilles Institution: San Diego State University Version: 1.0 (07/16/2025)
